did.abstract: A one-page petition, followed by six pages of signatures, petitioning the Mayor and Common Council of Brooklyn in opposition to the means of assessing personal property in widening Myrtle Street, Brooklyn, N.Y.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Myrtle Street assessment petition, 1834, 1978.040, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023. At that time, the document was folded in a legal-size folder and had ripped along several of its creases. It was moved to a flat file to lessen further damage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A one-page petition, followed by six pages of signatures, petitioning the Mayor and Common Council of Brooklyn in opposition to the means of assessing personal property in widening Myrtle Street, Brooklyn, N.Y. The pages were attached into one long scroll, but after being folded, have ripped along several creases and the document is now in several pieces.
